paragraphs.text: There are two ways to prevent elections from yielding political change. One is to rig — or, at least, put a thumb on the scale — in favor of one political coalition. That’s what can be accomplished through gerrymandering, voter ID laws, and other efforts to suppress the vote.
paragraphs.name: cd1e

paragraphs.text: Gerrymandering has been around for quite some time. I am not sure who gets credit for “creating” it, but this not a new concept. I agree our system is broken in many ways, but neither the Republican or Democratic party are looking to…

98d021ada67a.title: What the writer of this article fails to understand, or at least fails to tell the reader, is that…

paragraphs.text: What the writer of this article fails to understand, or at least fails to tell the reader, is that this country isn’t a Democracy. We are a Republic. The popular vote has only a limited correlation to who wins. The only vote total that matters is the Electoral College results. This was intended by the Founding Fathers so that one or two population…
